title: ID extended slab serif
content:
Hi everyone!

This is my first post, I hope this is not too obvious a query. I can't get there alone, I had a hunch that it might be an extended geometric slab, but came up empty.

I'm looking for the M & K.

Thanks in advance  
Foz

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013531im_/http:/typophile.com/files/kl_logo_3911.jpg)
author: Foz

comments.content:
Hi Foz,

that looks like [Hellenic Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013531/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000094#flont).

More alternatives in this list: [Wood Type: Wide Slab](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013531/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontlist/genres/wood_type_wide_slab/).  
Additionally:  
 [Antique Central](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013531/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/aboutype/antique-central/)  
 [Archive Antique Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013531/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/archivetype/archive-antique-extended/)  
 [Hefty](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013531/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/hefty.htm)  
 [Platon](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013531/http:/www.csaimages.com/results.asp?image=FNT018&wwwflag=2&imagepos=18)  
 [Stereo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150318013531/http:/hem.passagen.se/spsweet/font2/stereo.html)  
F

Hi Florian,

Thanks for that, I realise now after some searching on those that this is a common request on here, sorry!
